cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 220 miles SE of Galveston, Texas

motion.direction: N (expected to turn WNW later today)

cyclone.trajectory: Very slow drift, then a gradual west-northwest to northwest motion toward the central Texas coast; thereafter bending northward across southeast Texas and Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast (roughly between Port Aransas and Freeport)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning, Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Port Aransas TX to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Port Aransas TX to Morgan City LA; Storm Surge Warning from Port Aransas TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA (including Sabine Lake)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Baffin Bay TX eastward to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA, including Sabine Lake and the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Monday night through Tuesday with a 28 % cumulative chance of 34-kt winds and a 4 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible along Sabine Lake and the Port Arthur waterfront beginning Monday and persisting into Tuesday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 20 inches expected, producing flash and urban flooding around the port and the lower Sabine River.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and potential minor river flooding could disrupt vessel operations and landside logistics.
